entry.title: ios: Reconfigure PartitionAlloc at run-time.
entry.content:
iOS was missing three reconfigure methods:

ReconfigureEarlyish

ReconfigureAfterFeatureListInit

ReconfigureAfterTaskRunnerInit



This will enable the default off PA-E features memory reclaimer

and thread-cache purgers.



Disable PartitionAllocBackupRefPtr in fieldtrial testing config

to restart testing.

entry.title: Refactor connector and ensure key delivery
entry.content:
Now with the change in missived that stopped pinging Chrome on unmanaged

device, we need to ensure encryption key is delivered once the device is

enrolled (normally it would happen once the device posts a new event,

but in rare case that the device goes offline soon after enrollment and

before any event is posted, we still want to have the key available for

posting events on the device while it is offline.



Refactoring tracks CloudPolicyCore and CloudPolicyClient as before, but

once the device is enrolled, the client may or may not be available during Chrome initialization, and when it becomes available, dummy

upload is started in order to deliver encryption key.



Tested manually on VM (in addition to unit tests and

git cl try -B luci.chrome.try -b win-celab-try-rel)



Bug: b:327243582

Change-Id: If0f9ae2c307b6c15aa0b0f3ca876a6091423f43e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5332833

Auto-Submit: Leonid Baraz

Commit-Queue: Leonid Baraz

Reviewed-by: Josh Hilke

Commit-Queue: Josh Hilke

entry.title: Reduce test flakiness by adding inRoot call.
entry.content:
Test has been flaky in API 30+ with espresso 3.2:



"Waited for the root of the view hierarchy to have window focus and not

request layout for 10 seconds. If you specified a non default root

matcher, it may be picking a root that never takes focus."



This adds a root matcher to prevent error.



Before change, test failed about 1/10. After change it passed 80/80

entry.title: [Recent Tabs] Handle group -> tab conversion
entry.content:
When closing a subset of tabs in a tab group save them in recent tabs

as individual tabs rather than treating them as an tab group. The old

behavior to treat them as a tab group was problematic as it would result

in duplicate tab groups being created as the group would be bifurcated

when it was saved in recent tabs.



Bug: 327166316

Change-Id: Id67a78ce6f44da2115ad8c31059ff770d5ae460c

entry.title: [User Education] Tweaks to IPH checks and metrics.
entry.content:
This CL makes a few minor changes to the metrics that are emitted when

an IPH fails to show:



In V1, the old "non-clicker policy" of preventing reshow after abort has

been changed from kSnoozed to kRecentlyAborted, to be in line with V2

metrics.



The order of checks when an IPH is requested has been changed to go from

more severe/permanent to more transient:

1. Already queued for startup (exclusive with #2/#3).

2. IPH not registered.

3. Feature disabled.

4. Already dismissed or snoozed.

5. Blocked by session policy.

6. Blocked by another promo.

7. Blocked due to missing anchor, no focus, or incompatible UI state.

8. Blocked by the Feature Engagement Tracker.

9. Failed to create the IPH bubble itself.



This change means that an IPH that has e.g. already been dismissed, or

whose feature is disabled, is never recorded as being blocked by another

promo or by the UI.



Bug: 327657449

Change-Id: I0b75c5d58c496e8815e45d49a1dfdfb16d67912c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5336323

entry.title: [Text Contrast] Update LegacyDisplayGlobals to take all render params
entry.content:
This change updates SetCachedPixelGeometry to include additional

rendering parameters for text contrast and gamma. These new values

aren't in use yet but will be soon, see

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5283107



These values are behind a lock. Architecturally, these parameters

are subject to data races, and have been for some time. This is

not a major problem in practice. However, we don't want to introduce

the scenario where the parameters are out-of-sync with each other,

so this change gates them all behind a shared lock.



Bug: 1160653

entry.title: Simplify Redactor logic.
entry.content:
Collapses Rule and CachedRule into a single object, since these are both

built at "FromProto" time anyway. This consolidates the validation logic.



Use non-optional types in Rule, since there is mostly no semantic

difference between the zero values and nullopt (and this distinction

does not exist in the proto3 serverside versions).



There are two minor behavior changes from this:



1. An explicit empty-string replacement_string is now handled like

an omitted replacement_string ([#+] redactions), previously this

would delete the redacted value.

2. empty string regex is treated like omitted regex (the rule is

ignored) previously it was processed as a rule, but matches

would never be valid (they'd be empty).



Change-Id: If3d52d47dbd4d43ad470777608dcc26fc70903c6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5337275

Original change's description:

> Reland "Update magic toolbar entrypoint if page is translated"

>

> This is a reland of commit 6c689c58f5f4987dc2fd44200a7565008834d7a2

>

> Original change's description:

> > Update magic toolbar entrypoint if page is translated

> >

> > This is a temporary solution for the MTB incorrectly remaining visible

> > when a page is translated to an unsupported language. It doesn't help

> > with the case where a page whose original language is unsupported is

> > translated to a supported language and may become readable. The fix for

> > that case requires sending a translation language with the readability

> > check, which will be implemented in several later changes.

> >

> > This change assumes that a page that is readable in one supported

> > language will be readable in other supported languages, which seems to

> > be true so far.

entry.title: [ProtectedAudience] Add more generateBid() browserSignals tests.
entry.content:
In particular, make sure that bidCount and prevWins are updated or

not as appropriate in the following cases:



* Interest group bids but another group wins the auction.

* Interest group bids but the seller rejects all bids.

* Interest group bids but the seller throws an exception.

* Interest group does not bid.



Add the following tests for bidCount only (they're just less interesting

for prevWins, though could test it in that case, too)

* Interest group does not bid, but another group does and wins the

auction.

* Interest group bids but the seller rejects the bid,

and another interest group wins the auction.



Also add a prevWins test where two auctions are run at once (matching

a pre-existing bidCount one), and the unique test case:

* Interest group bids but the seller gives the bid a low score,

and another interest group wins the auction.



Bug: 40261114

entry.title: Android: Use out/<dir> for orderfile builds
entry.content:
This CL switches from stashing output directories under `out/Release` to

directly using directories like `out/orderfile_arm_instrumented_out`.

Previously that would have been stashed under

`out/Release/arm_instrumented_out/Release`. This also means the

orderfile scripts are migrating away from using 'Release' as the only

name for the output directory.



Use pathlib.Path in a few more places and add typing to a few methods so

that the editor can alert us if a pathlib.Path is passed instead of str

or vice versa. Most python methods are already compatible with both, but

notably the cmd arg passed to subprocess.Popen is a list of strings, not

pathlike objects.



Standardize on expecting the source repo to be the one that contains the

orderfile_generator_backend.py (most scripts on bots assume this).

Assume that the output directory is named `out` and is in `//out`.

Assume that the build directory is the same as the source directory.



Switch some strings to f-strings to make them more readable. Added an

assert to help the editor recognize where self._compiler should be

guaranteed non-None.



Removed some redundant comments now that some parameter and return value

types are specified via type annotations directly.



Added a --clobber option so that it is easy to clear the entire `//out`

directory on the bot on demand.



Removed the unused AndroidProfileTool._RunProfileCollection method and

other now-unused methods.



Bug: 327229370

entry.title: [iOS] Replace usage of deprecated APIs in screen_ios.mm
entry.content:
As of iOS 16, [UIScreen mainScreen] and [UIScreen screens] are

deprecated. Instead of getting global information about screens using

these APIs, applications can instead find out about screens that

are associated with the application's current UIWindows.



This CL updates screen_ios.mm to stop using the deprecated APIs by

using an arbitrary screen from the set of screens associated with

the application's windows instead of [UIScreen mainScreen], and by

counting screens associated with the application's windows instead of

using [UIScreen screens]. In both cases, the new approach may give

different results than the old one, since the old behavior cannot be

exactly replicated using current APIs.

entry.title: autosleep: Implement interval in the future case for the TaskExecutor
entry.content:
Now when the interval is in the future, the

RepeatingTimeIntervalTaskExecutor schedules the NativeTimer to the

start of the interval. Which in turn schedules the timers that call the

appropriate callbacks.



In addition to that, now we do not schedule the timer to the end of the

interval when the remaining time is less than a fixed amount.



Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter=*RepeatingTimeIntervalTaskExecutor*

entry.title: [Tab Group] Fix getTabGroupCount for tab groups with size 1
entry.content:
TabGroupModelFilter wasn't correctly tracking tab groups with size 1.



Increment when:

* Creating a single tab group.

* Adding a single tab that is in a tab group.



Decrement when:

* Closing the last tab in a group rather than when size becomes 1.

* Removing the last tab from a tab group with size 1.



Modify logic when adding a tab to the tab model as part of a group

so that the group is created later and we can properly signal if a

new group was created or not.

entry.title: [//gpu] ClientSI: Assume native buffer on Mac if SI has WebGPU usage
entry.content:
The conceptual semantics of

ClientSharedImage::GetTextureTarget(BufferUsage) are that it determines

whether this instance is backed by a native buffer based on the usage of

the instance, and then returns the appropriate texture target one way or

the other.



Currently, the method assumes that the instance is backed by a native

buffer iff it has SCANOUT usage. However, on Mac WebGPU usage also

results in the instance being backed by an IOSurface. This CL refines

this method to also return the texture target used with native buffers

in that case.



This refinement in semantics will concretely be needed to refactor a

usage of GetBufferTextureTarget() in CanvasResource. None of the

existing conversions were to SharedImages created with WebGPU usage, so

the CL is a no-op in the codebase as it stands.



Bug: 41494843

Change-Id: I208fc3a40c86ace8b10b665b56eef73a786943e8

entry.title: [Autofill] Do not extract visible ad frames
entry.content:
This CL strengthens the necessary condition for adding a frame to

FormFieldData::child_frames.



Before this CL, both non-ad frames and visible ad frames were added.

After this CL, if the new Finch feature is enabled, only non-ad frames

are added.



The main objective of this CL is to get rid of

Element::BoundsInWidget() call in IsVisibleIframe(). There are

however two more calls in InferLabelFromOverlayingSuccessor().

entry.title: Wait for attestation before removing registration items
entry.content:
If the prohibited registrations are erased before enqueued, they may be

dropped if attestations loading is not done yet. This is currently fine, as it's default to allowed if attestations is not loaded but if this

behavior is changed, it may cause data loss for app<>web.



To prevent this, in this CL, we enqueue the registration to ensure that

the attestation is loaded before erasing any registration items.



Change-Id: Id985afb0bcd509517a9714096d7956b169327e19

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5332155

Commit-Queue: Anthony Garant

Reviewed-by: Nan Lin

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1267951}

entry.title: Workaround to deflake 3PC heuristics WPT.
entry.content:
Firefox is flaky on both assertions for default 3PC access. Force-failing the test to avoid calling these flaky assertions until Firefox implements them. (We don't want to force-succeed as it will hide the test which is tentative but should be implemented.)

entry.title: [iOS] Make DriveTabHelper Inherit LazyWebStateUserData
entry.content:
This CL refactors DriveTabHelper to use LazyWebStateUserData instead

of WebStateUserData. This also makes use of the new method

GetOrCreateForWebState which is used as a replacement to FromWebState

or CreateWebState. The main difference is that when

kEnableStartupImprovements is enabled, DriveTabHelper isn't attached

in AttachTabHelpers and is instead attached when a WebState needs to

add it as a dependency.

entry.title: Conditionally snap the decoration line geometry
entry.content:
For text decorations on SVG text we don't want to snap the position of

them because that may produce poor results in some cases. We already

don't round the thickness of the decoration line.



In DecorationLinePainter::DrawLineForText() only call SnapYAxis()

conditionally based on if a cc::PaintFlags is passed - which currently

mean that SVG text is being painted. Other decoration styles than solid

are not supported yet on SVG text.



Bug: 40887872

entry.title: [views_ax] Migrated from OverrideLabelledBy to SetName(View&)
entry.content:
This CL migrates calls to OverrideLabelledBy to calls to the new setter.



These have equivalent behavior.



This is a continuation of CL:5309768 which is part of a project

to transition the querying of accessible data from a "pull" system

to a "push" system.



There is no need for the NameFrom parameter since the default one

for the current use cases is simply to use kRelatedElement.



There are no behavior changes.

entry.title: Add a new method Exo::Buffer::GetBufferId.
entry.content:
Add a new method GetBufferId() in exo::Buffer which

returns GpuMemoryBuffer pointer as the BufferId.



This BufferId can be used as a unique id to identify the

GMB as well as a bool to identify of the exo::Buffer contains

the GMB or not.



Update exo::Buffer and exo::Surface to use this BufferId() instead of

gfx_buffer() and GMB pointer directly as a bool.

entry.title: Relax AImageReader max queue size restriction for BroadCom tv.
entry.content:
Currently AImageReader max queue size is set to 1 for all android tvs

since most of them do not support more than 1 images. This can cause

flickering and black frames for some devices during video playback.



Relax this restriction by manufacturer name Broadcom since it

supports more than 1 image.

entry.title: web_app: Fixed the issue where the height of the installation dialog box is too large.
entry.content:
After BoxLayout was modified to LayoutManagerBase, the cache of

LayoutManagerBase became the main reason for layout failure. Setting the

height of the image in the Layout method of ImageCarouselView failed to

trigger the cache failure of LayoutManagerBase. This requires us to get

the correct preferred size from the very beginning.

entry.title: [SHv2] Remove undo snack bar for 'Done' state
entry.content:
Safety Hub modules Unused Site Permissions and Notifications offer to

the user the list of origins for review and actions to take on them.

Each action currently is followed by 'Undo' snack bar. However, for

cases where the action leads to 'Done' state the 'Undo' snack bar is

redundant since the state already has the undo button itself.

This CL removes the snack bar for these scenarios.



Notifications module scenarios:

- Multiple/Single origin(s) for review -> Click 'Block All'

- Single origin for review -> Click 'Block'/'Allow'/'Reset'



Unused Site Permissions module:

- Multiple/Single origin(s) for review -> Click 'Got it'

- Single origin for review -> Click 'Allow again'



While at it, fix a few things for Notifications module

'Single origin for review' -> click 'Block all' case. Namely:

- Fix the wrong metric value recording. Namely, 'Undo' button click results in recording .UNDO_BLOCK instead of .UNDO_BLOCK_ALL enum value.

- Fix the snack bar and the 'Done' state header strings.



Potentially this also fixes the issues in b/41483087.



Bug: 1443466

Fixed: 1510537, 1517702, 1517705

entry.title: [Android TRM] Remove module if it hides after already being shown.
entry.content:
It's possible for the Tab Resumption Module to show in the Magic Stack

at first, and then hides. This can happen for:

* Permission change, e.g., change in login or sync status.

* Transient loading: Stale suggestions are first shown, but update

reveals empty suggestions.

* (Upcoming) Transient loading involving placeholders.



Previously we simply set module visibility to NONE to hide a TRM that's

already shown. However, now that the TRM is integrated into the

Magic Stack, this is insufficient. A symptom of this is the presence of

blank spaces where the TRM used to be.



The fix is simple: Call ModuleDelegate.removeModule() when we hide the

TRM, after it already has been shown.



This CL also refactors the Mediator:

* Remove |mHasPreviousLoad|.

* Make the Mediator a finite state machine where |mModuleState| can be

{INIT, SHOWN, GONE}.

Here, INIT replaces |mHasPreviousLoad = false|, SHOWN replaces

|suggestions != null|, and GONE replaces |suggestions == null|.

* Non-self-loop irreversible transitions:

* INIT -> SHOWN: Call ModuleDelegate.onDataReady().

* INIT -> GONE: Call ModuleDelegate.onDataFetchFailed().

* SHOWN -> GONE: Call ModuleDelegate.removeModule().



Bug: 327625148, 1515325

Change-Id: I1b3aa5150853d97ccccb174fe7333621000bb7ef

entry.title: NSS: Prevent Chrome from crash on public slot in tests
entry.content:
Chrome is intentionally crashing when it fails to load the public

slot. In tests this can also happen if the public slot is not faked

correctly. Add a code branch that only compiles for tests to

prevent the crash.



This wasn’t a problem until now because NssService is created on

demand, but the upcoming changes around Kcer always check NSS on

profile creation. In unit tests there is no common place where it

can be conveniently faked, so fix it with a “for testing” branch

in the implementation.

entry.title: WebUI: Ensure initial render in CrLitElement when focus() is called.
entry.content:
The following pattern

dom-if > parent PolymerElement -> child LitElement

is already known to cause an odd case where a LitElement is connected

to the DOM, but its connectedCallback has not triggered yet.



This CL extends existing logic to ensure an initial render when the $

dictionary is accessed, to also happen when the focus() method is

called.



This is necessary since in upcoming Lit migration CLs it was discovered

that focus() calls can silently result in a no-op when the case above

happens. More specifically this is in preparation of migrating

cr-icon-button to Lit, which adds a `tabindex` as part of its initial

render, and without it is non-focusable.



Addressing this in the CrLitElement base class, seems better than

only doing this in cr-icon-button's focus(), since other elements can

suffer from the same issue.



Bug: 40943652

entry.title: Implement a thread pool system for RealtimeAudioWorkletThread
entry.content:
This change implements a thread management system can contain up to 4 concurrent real-time threads based on “first come first served”

policy:

- The 1st ~ 3rd threads are a “dedicated” thread.

- The 4th thread is a “shared” thread: Starting from the 4th

AudioWorklet, all subsequent contexts will share the same thread

for the AudioWorklet operation.

- The thread creation is on-demand; the thread pool starts with zero

thread and create one when requested from the client up to 4

threads.



Also this change is only applicable to the top-level frame; the threading system in an iframe will share a single backing thread for all AudioWorklet operation within a document.

entry.title: Reland "Android: Use assert_no_deps to ensure java and native trees do not connect"
entry.content:
This reverts commit b46fadd958b824bb6e3cedbf3c2415d6bec3b5f6.



Reason for reland: Added missing deps



Original change's description:

> Revert "Android: Use assert_no_deps to ensure java and native trees do not connect"

>

> This reverts commit c6ebc3f815d64748a9eabd3a4fb05afb91f6b8d9.

>

> Reason for revert: only suspect for build breakage, see https://crbug.com/327241558

>

> Original change's description:

> > Android: Use assert_no_deps to ensure java and native trees do not connect

> >

> > Our java and native build graphs are meant to be independent, but

> > sometimes deps are added between them. The deps do not do anything, but

> > slow down builds by reducing parallelism. These checks should prevent

> > such deps from being introduced.

> >

> > To achieve this parallelism, adds an "asset_deps" field to android_apk

> > and android_bundle_module targets that enable adding deps directly to

> > the "package_apk" step. This was needed for

> > libchrome_unwind_table_assets and loadable_modules.

> >

> > Bug: 325619950

> > Change-Id: I36c8cd3757650249e3d544310208825882dcad4d

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5301510

> > Reviewed-by: Peter Wen

> > Commit-Queue: Andrew Grieve

entry.title: KcerFactory: Fix NSS retrieval
entry.content:
Use base::BindOnce instead of base::BindPostTask for the callback

for the NSS getter. The returned NSS database is only guaranteed

to be valid in one task, but base::BindPostTask creates an

intermediate task that posts the target task on a given task

runner.



The additional reposting of the task is unnecessary, it is running

on the correct sequence either way.

entry.title: Add PlusAddressWebDataService
entry.content:
The WebDataService is responsible for posting tasks from the UI thread

to the DB sequence and querying PlusAddressTable there. As such, it

mirrors PlusAddressTable's API.

For read requests, results are returned to a WebDataServiceConsumer. For

that, a new WDResultType for PlusAddresses is defined.



PlusAddressWebDataService is owned and created by the (profile scoped)

WebDataServiceWrapper. A function is added to WebDataServiceFactory (the

class managing the profile and the account scoped WebDataServiceWrapper)

to retrieve the PlusAddressWebDataService.

Later CLs will use that to inject the PlusAddressWebDataService into the

PlusAddressService, so it can access the database.



Bug: b/322147254

Change-Id: If4540dbb2b0f33ec4985c78370aeae270bb4dc1f

entry.title: Remove GpuFeatureData::disabled
entry.content:
Remove the `disabled` field from GpuFeatureData. It provided a duplicate

way to say a feature was disabled vs `status` field. This resulted in a

bug where the feature was only considered disabled for printing GPU

problems in GetProblemsImpl() if disabled field was set and not if the

status field was set similarly.

entry.title: iwa: Cleanup superfluous instance variables and improve tests
entry.content:
This makes `IsolatedWebAppApplyUpdateCommand` more consistent with the

prepare update and install commands (see crrev.com/c/5317617), and also

removes duplication between `installed_app_`, `update_info()`, and

`update_location_`.



We also fix a mixup between dev mode and prod mode in one of the tests,

as well as using `ASSERT_NO_FATAL_FAILURE` in another test to avoid

segfaults.
